org.mt4j.util.animation

Class MultiPurposeInterpolator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mt4j.util.animation.MultiPurposeInterpolator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iinterpolator

    public class MultiPurposeInterpolator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Iinterpolator
    The Class MultiPurposeInterpolator.

    Interpolator class, used to get interpolated values between start and the destination values
    Author:
    Christopher Ruff

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultiPurposeInterpolator(float from, float to, float interpolationDuration, float accelerationEndTime, float decelerationStartTime, int loopCount)
      Initializes a new Interpolator object, used to get interpolated values between the start and the destination.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getCurrentStepDelta()
      Returns the unnormalized delta value from the last interpolated value to the current, after a interpolationstep - useful to determine how much the value increased/decreased.
      float getCurrentValue()
      Returns the un-normalized value of the current interpolation.
      float getTimeTaken()
      Gets the time taken.
      boolean interpolate(float deltaTime)
      Does the next interpolation step, taking the timeDelta into account This implementation makes sure the destination is reached exactly, and sets the value to the target value if the next interpolation step would surpass the target value, or if the time is up.
      boolean isAlternating()
      Checks if is alternating.
      boolean isFinished()
      checks if the interpolation has reached its target and there are no more loops left.
      void resetInterpolator()
      Reset interpolator.
      void setAlternating(boolean alternating)
      Sets the alternating.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiPurposeInterpolator

        public MultiPurposeInterpolator(float from,
                                float to,
                                float interpolationDuration,
                                float accelerationEndTime,
                                float decelerationStartTime,
                                int loopCount)
        Initializes a new Interpolator object, used to get interpolated values between the start and the destination.
        Parameters:
        from - the value to start the interpolation from
        to - the value to interpolate to
        interpolationDuration - the duration of interpolation
        accelerationEndTime - defines the normalized time until when the Easing IN takes place (normalized, value from 0..1) (i.e. 0.25f)
        decelerationStartTime - defines the time from when the Easing OUT takes place (normalized, value from 0..1) (i.e. 0.75f)
        loopCount - how often to loop the interpolation, Value of "-1" loops infinitely

    • Method Detail

      • resetInterpolator

        public void resetInterpolator()
        Description copied from interface: Iinterpolator
        Reset interpolator.
        Specified by:
        resetInterpolator in interface Iinterpolator

      • interpolate

        public boolean interpolate(float deltaTime)
        Does the next interpolation step, taking the timeDelta into account

        This implementation makes sure the destination is reached exactly, and sets the value to the target value if the next interpolation step would surpass the target value, or if the time is up.

        Specified by:
        interpolate in interface Iinterpolator
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - amount of time to interpolate
        Returns:
        true, if interpolate false if this call to interpolate() would lead to a higher value than the desired target value or the time is up, true if the target isnt reached in this interpolation step and there is still remaining time

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        checks if the interpolation has reached its target and there are no more loops left.
        Specified by:
        isFinished in interface Iinterpolator
        Returns:
        true: if the interpolation is finished, then you shouldnt call interpolate() again, false: if there are still loops to do, and/or the target hasnt been reached

      • getTimeTaken

        public float getTimeTaken()
        Gets the time taken.
        Returns:
        the time taken

        public boolean isAlternating()
        Checks if is alternating.
        Returns:
        true, if is alternating

      • getCurrentStepDelta

        public float getCurrentStepDelta()
        Returns the unnormalized delta value from the last interpolated value to the current, after a interpolationstep - useful to determine how much the value increased/decreased.
        Specified by:
